javadoc:
Iterates over index field values within a specified range.
 NOTE: Index fields which have been truncated may be returned out of order.

methods.javadoc: Construct an index field iterator starting with the minimum index value.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct an index field iterator starting with the minimum index value.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct an index field iterator.  The iterator is positioned at index 
 value identified by startValue.

params.name: minValue
params.comment: minimum index value or null if no minimum

params.name: maxValue
params.comment: maximum index value or null if no maximum

params.name: before
params.comment:
if true initial position is before minValue, else position
 after maxValue

methods.name: delete
methods.comment:
Delete all primary records which have the current
 index value (lastKey).

name: IndexFieldIterator
comment:
Iterates over index field values within a specified range.
 NOTE: Index fields which have been truncated may be returned out of order.
